formal_accuser.name: Jacqueline
formal_accuser.relationship_to_accused: accuser who identified her by her big nose

confession.devil_appearance: something like a person, very cold
confession.seduction_context: Woke up to find something like a person next to her, which was very cold. Thought it had copulated with her while she slept, and emitted substance cold as marble. Husband was in tavern as usual, and she was angry about how he was wasting his money. Visitor asked why she was sad, and she complained about her husband, who tormented her and spent her money; he said she should leave her 'gourmand de mary' and 'il y donroit ordre'. Made her renounce God and take him for master, scratched her on front.

witnesses.name: Margueritte femme Jean Curty
witnesses.relationship_to_accused: neighbor, had quarrels and lawsuit against her

harms_alleged.time_after_quarrel: same day as quarrel, about an hour later

testimony.quarrel_subject: she intervened in quarrel between him and his wife, he told her to mind her own business and struck her

timeline.subject: Ydatte Marchal
timeline.details: Initial interrogation, confronted with Jacqueline who accused her

timeline.subject: Ydatte Marchal
timeline.details: Substitut for PG asks for execution after interrogation under torture

timeline.subject: Ydatte Marchal
timeline.details: Confrontations with those she had accused

timeline.subject: Ydatte Marchal
timeline.details: Substitut asks for death sentence following confrontations

timeline.subject: Ydatte Marchal
timeline.details: Change de Nancy approved with additional requirement to check with those she had harmed to verify misfortunes occurred

timeline.subject: Witnesses
timeline.details: Informations taken from 4 witnesses to verify harms

timeline.subject: Ydatte Marchal
timeline.details: Formal death sentence from court at St Nicolas

accomplices_named.name: la Petiatte
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat, tante à la Gueriatte, recognised by her face, was neighbour

accomplices_named.name: wife of Jean Pierre, cordier a la Val
Jacqueline
accomplices_named.context: Seen at sabbat, was also her accuser

accomplices_named.name: Annon veuve du maire François Piccard

notable_quotes.speaker: Ydatte Marchal
notable_quotes.french: que sy elle est sorciere elle n'en scait rien, et qu'il fauldroit qu'elle soit née en ceste planette
notable_quotes.english: that if she is a witch she knows nothing of it, and that she would have to have been born under that planet
notable_quotes.context: When confronted by Jacqueline who accused her

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (Creusson)
notable_quotes.context: Referring to her husband who was wasting money in tavern

notable_quotes.speaker: Devil (Creusson)
notable_quotes.english: he would put things in order
notable_quotes.context: Promising to deal with her husband problem

notable_quotes.speaker: Ydatte Marchal
notable_quotes.english: Said she was a poor sinner, asking to be put to death quickly

relationships.evidence_text: first husband had been Humbert Joulain, baker of St Nicolas
had quarrelled with her, lawsuit against her
he chased her hens out of his garden
la Petiatte, tante à la Gueriatte
Annon veuve du maire François Piccard de Drouville

economic_context.details: Claude Curty, portier a la Val, had seized some of her property, leading to dispute. Husband was chartier (carter) who wasted money in tavern. Had 8 children by first husband (baker), all dead; only one by second husband, stillborn. Lived at St Nicolas for 16 years. Economic hardship evident from husband's drinking and wasting money, property seizure, and her statement about poverty.

harms_catalog.method_alleged: black powder, then cured with white powder

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: wife of man who seized her property
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: dispute with Claude Curty who had seized some of her property
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: a year earlier than torture interrogation (1608)

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he was beating his wife, when she intervened to separate them he beat her too
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: a week after quarrel, master came and incited her
harms_catalog.method_alleged: master made him ill (method not specified)

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: son of people who called her witch
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Curty and his wife quarrelled with her and called her witch

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: animal of people who called her witch
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Curty and his wife quarrelled with her and called her witch

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: animal of man who chased her hens
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: he chased her hens out of his garden

harms_catalog.victim_relationship_to_witness: wife of baker who struck her
harms_catalog.harm_description: became ill, all swollen, and finally died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: intervened in their quarrel, he struck her and she took him to court

material_culture.context: devil gave her money which proved to be oak leaves

material_culture.object: powder (black to kill, white to heal)
material_culture.context: devil gave her powder for maleficium and healing
troutieres jeunes filles asked her for bread to cure Curty's wife, she put white powder in it
wore masks at sabbat while dancing
her hens went into François Mourel's garden

spatial_references.context: primary location of trial, residence of accused and witnesses
residence of Claude Curty (portier a la Val) and Jean Pierre (cordier a la Val)
residence of Annon veuve du maire François Piccard

economic_hardship_indicators: 8 children from first marriage all dead, one stillborn from second marriage

prior_legal_disputes.description: Girard Mathis struck her when she intervened in quarrel between him and his wife
Claude Curty seized some of her property

legal_context.redress_outcome: took Girard Mathis to court after he struck her

change_de_nancy.modification_details: 31 August: approved death sentence with additional requirement that check be made with those she had harmed to verify that misfortunes had really occurred as she said

emotional_state_notes: said she was ashamed to confess earlier about devil seduction
at end asked to be put to death quickly, called herself 'poor sinner'

third_parties.context: husband who wasted money in tavern, was there when devil visited

third_parties.context: had 8 children with him, all died

third_parties.name: Claude Curty
third_parties.relationship_to_accused: portier a la Val who seized her property
third_parties.context: had dispute with accused, seized her property, wife and son were harmed

third_parties.name: son of Jean/Claude Curty
third_parties.context: aged 6 or 7, died week after becoming suddenly ill returning from school

third_parties.name: late wife of Girard Mathis
third_parties.context: became ill and died after quarrel, believed herself bewitched

third_parties.name: François Mourel
third_parties.context: chased her hens out of his garden, his cow died

third_parties.context: came to say cow was dying, suggested it was bewitched

third_parties.name: troutieres jeunes filles
third_parties.context: young girls asked accused for bread, she suspected this was to cure Curty's wife

third_parties.context: cordier a la Val, his wife allegedly seen at sabbat

third_parties.name: la Gueriatte
third_parties.context: niece of la Petiatte who was allegedly seen at sabbat

third_parties.name: François Piccard
third_parties.context: maire of Drouville, deceased, his widow Annon allegedly seen at sabbat

extraction_metadata.notes: Complete trial record with clear timeline. Witness testimonies taken after torture confession to verify harms claimed by accused. Uncertainty: The names Jean Curty (husband of witness 1) and Claude Curty (mentioned in confession) may be the same person or related - the text uses both names for 'portier' role. The term 'troutieres jeunes filles' is unclear - may be a location descriptor or occupation. Devil's name 'Creusson' recorded. Accused showed unusual healing practice (white powder to cure). Economic hardship evident throughout. Notable that Change de Nancy required verification of harms before approving death sentence.
